questions.question: A global company with a large number of AWS accounts is seeking a way in which they can centrally manage billing and security policies across all accounts. Which AWS Service will assist them in meeting these goals?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows you to centrally manage billing, apply security policies, and control access across multiple AWS accounts from a single management account.

questions.question: Which service provides object-level storage in AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 provides object-level storage, making it ideal for storing and retrieving any amount of data.

questions.question: A company is concerned that they are spending money on underutilized compute resources in AWS. Which AWS feature will help ensure that their applications are automatically adding/removing EC2 compute capacity to closely match the required demand?
questions.explanation: AWS Auto Scaling automatically adjusts EC2 instances to match demand, ensuring cost-effectiveness and availability.

questions.question: Which S3 storage class is best for data with unpredictable access patterns?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 Intelligent-Tiering automatically moves data between two access tiers when access patterns change, making it best for unpredictable access.

questions.question: What is the AWS database service that allows you to upload data structured in key-value format?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a key-value and document database that delivers single-digit millisecond performance at any scale.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT correct regarding Amazon EC2 On-demand instances?

options.text: You have to pay a start-up fee when launching a new instance for the first time.
The on-demand instances follow the AWS pay-as-you-go pricing model.
With on-demand instances, no longer-term commitments or upfront payments are needed.
When using on-demand Linux instances, you are charged per second based on an hourly rate.

questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 On-Demand instances don’t require upfront payments or start-up fees. You only pay for what you use.

questions.question: A company has moved to AWS recently. Which of the following AWS Services will help ensure that they have the proper security settings? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor checks for best practices, and Amazon Inspector assesses application security, helping maintain strong security settings.

questions.question: What is the AWS feature that provides an additional level of security above the default authentication mechanism of usernames and passwords?
questions.explanation: AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds an extra layer of protection beyond just username and password.

questions.question: A company is introducing a new product to their customers, and is expecting a surge in traffic to their web application. As part of their Enterprise Support plan, which of the following provides the company with architectural and scaling guidance?
questions.explanation: Infrastructure Event Management (IEM) provides architectural and scaling guidance during critical events.

questions.question: You work as an on-premises MySQL DBA. The work of database configuration, backups, patching, and DR can be time-consuming and repetitive. Your company has decided to migrate to the AWS Cloud. Which of the following can help save time on database maintenance so you can focus on data architecture and performance?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS automates database tasks like backups, patching, and scaling so you can focus on application performance.

questions.question: Which of the below is a best-practice when designing solutions on AWS?

options.text: Invest heavily in architecting your environment, as it is not easy to change your design later.
Use AWS reservations to reduce costs when testing your production environment.
Automate wherever possible to make architectural (© ) experimentation easier.
Provision a large compute capacity to handle any spikes in load

questions.explanation: Automating architecture allows you to experiment and scale efficiently, aligning with best practices.

questions.question: According to the AWS Acceptable Use Policy, which of the following statements is true regarding penetration testing of EC2 instances?

options.text: Penetration testing is not allowed in AWS.
Penetration testing is performed automatically by AWS to determine vulnerabilities in your AWS infrastructure.
Penetration testing can be performed by the customer on their own instances without prior authorization from AWS.
The AWS customers are only allowed to perform penetration testing on services managed by AWS.

questions.explanation: AWS allows customers to conduct penetration testing on their own resources without prior approval, under certain conditions.

questions.question: Which service is used to ensure that messages between software components are not lost if one or more components fail?
questions.explanation: Amazon SQS ensures message durability and reliable communication between decoupled application components.

questions.question: The principle “design for failure and nothing will fail” is very important when designing your AWS Cloud architecture. Which of the following would help adhere to this principle? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Using Availability Zones and Elastic Load Balancing increases availability and adheres to ‘design for failure’ principles.

questions.question: What is the AWS service that provides a virtual network dedicated to your AWS account?
questions.explanation: Amazon VPC provides a logically isolated virtual network dedicated to your AWS account.

questions.question: According to the AWS Shared responsibility model, which of the following are the responsibility of the customer? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Managing environmental events of AWS data centers.
Protecting the confidentiality of data in transit in Amazon S3.
Controlling physical access to AWS Regions.
Ensuring that the underlying EC2 host is configured properly.
Patching applications installed on Amazon EC2.

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for securing data in transit and patching applications, while AWS secures the infrastructure.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS services can be used as a compute resource? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 and AWS Lambda are compute services. EC2 offers virtual servers, while Lambda is serverless compute.

questions.question: Your company is designing a new application that will store and retrieve photos and videos. Which of the following services should you recommend as the underlying storage mechanism?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is designed for scalable object storage, ideal for storing and retrieving photos and videos.

questions.question: Which of the following is equivalent to a user name and password and is used to authenticate your programmatic access to AWS services and APIs?
questions.explanation: Access Keys consist of an access key ID and secret access key, functioning like a username and password for APIs.

questions.question: What does Amazon ElastiCache provide?

options.text: An Ehcache compatible in-memory data store.
An online software store that allows Customers to launch pre-configured software with just few clicks.
A domain name system in the cloud.

questions.explanation: Amazon ElastiCache provides in-memory caching, improving performance for read-heavy workloads.

questions.question: What is the AWS service that enables you to manage all of your AWS accounts from a single master account?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows managing multiple AWS accounts from a single master account.

questions.question: Which of the following EC2 instance purchasing options supports the Bring Your Own License (BYOL) model for almost every BYOL scenario?
questions.explanation: Dedicated Hosts support Bring Your Own License (BYOL) by giving visibility and control of physical servers.

questions.question: Which of the following is one of the benefits of moving infrastructure from an on-premises data center to AWS?

options.text: Free support for all enterprise customers.
AWS holds responsibility for managing customer applications.

questions.explanation: Migrating to AWS reduces Capital Expenditure (CapEx) by shifting to a pay-as-you-go model.

questions.question: Which of the following are important design principles you should adopt when designing systems on AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Always use Global Services in your architecture rather than Regional Services.
Always choose to pay as you go.

questions.explanation: Automating processes and eliminating single points of failure are critical AWS design principles.

questions.question: Which AWS Service can be used to establish a dedicated, private network connection between AWS and your datacenter?
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated network connection from your datacenter to AWS.

questions.question: You are working on two projects that require completely different network configurations. Which AWS service or feature will allow you to isolate resources and network configurations?
questions.explanation: Amazon VPC allows you to isolate network resources and configurations for separate projects.

questions.question: Which of the following services can help protect your web applications from SQL injection and other vulnerabilities in your application code?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF helps protect web applications from common exploits like SQL injection and cross-site scripting.

questions.question: An organization needs to analyze and process a large number of data sets. Which AWS service should they use?
questions.explanation: Amazon EMR is used for big data processing using open-source frameworks like Hadoop and Spark.

questions.question: Based on the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following are the sole responsibility of AWS? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS manages the physical infrastructure, including hardware maintenance and hypervisor creation.

questions.question: What is the AWS service that provides you the highest level of control over the underlying virtual infrastructure?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 provides the highest level of control over virtual infrastructure, including OS-level access.

questions.question: What are the default security credentials that are required to access the AWS management console for an IAM user account?
questions.explanation: IAM users need a username and password to access the AWS Management Console.

questions.question: In your on-premises environment, you can create as many virtual servers as you need from a single template. What can you use to perform the same in AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) let you launch multiple virtual servers from a single template.

questions.question: What are two advantages of using Cloud Computing over using traditional data centers? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Cloud computing advantages include distributed infrastructure and elimination of single points of failure.

questions.question: Which of the following aspects of security are managed by AWS? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for physical infrastructure and hardware patching, while customers manage logical security.

questions.question: Which statement best describes the operational excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?

options.text: The ability of a system to recover gracefully from failure.
The efficient use of computing resources to meet requirements.
The ability to monitor systems and improve supporting processes and procedures.
The ability to manage datacenter operations more efficiently.

questions.explanation: Operational excellence emphasizes monitoring, continuous improvement, and optimizing processes.

questions.question: AWS has created a large number of Edge Locations as part of its Global Infrastructure. Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using Edge Locations?

options.text: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to cache the most recent responses.
Edge locations are used by CloudFront to improve your end users’ experience when uploading files.
Edge locations are used by CloudFront to distribute traffic across multiple instances to reduce latency.
Edge locations are used by CloudFront to distribute content to global users with low latency.

questions.explanation: Edge locations provide caching and delivery, but not traffic distribution across compute instances.

questions.question: What are the change management tools that helps AWS customers audit and monitor all resource changes in their AWS environment? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail and AWS Config track and audit resource changes across your AWS environment.

questions.question: Which of the following services allows you to run containerized applications on a cluster of EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Amazon ECS allows you to run and manage containerized applications on a cluster of EC2 instances.

questions.question: Which of the following services will help businesses ensure compliance in AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail logs API activity and helps with compliance and auditing.

questions.question: Which of the following procedures will help reduce your Amazon S3 costs?

options.text: Use the Import/Export feature to move old files automatically to Amazon Glacier.
Use the right combination of storage classes based on different use cases.
Pick the right Availability Zone for your S3 bucket.
Move all the data stored in S3 standard to EBS.

questions.explanation: Using appropriate S3 storage classes helps reduce costs by aligning storage with data access needs.

questions.question: What are the AWS services/features that can help you maintain a highly available and fault-tolerant architecture in AWS? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Auto Scaling and Elastic Load Balancers help build highly available and fault-tolerant systems.

questions.question: Which of the following activities may help reduce your AWS monthly costs?

options.text: Enabling Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling for all of your workloads.
Using the AWS Network Load Balancer (NLB) to load balance the incoming HTTP requests.
Removing all of your Cost Allocation Tags.
Deploying your AWS resources across multiple Availability Zones.

questions.explanation: Auto Scaling helps reduce costs by adjusting compute resources to match workload demand.

questions.question: What is the AWS service/feature that takes advantage of Amazon CloudFront’s globally distributed edge locations to transfer files to S3 with higher upload speeds?
questions.explanation: S3 Transfer Acceleration leverages CloudFront edge locations to speed up uploads to S3.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS security features is associated with an EC2 instance and functions to filter incoming traffic requests?
questions.explanation: Security Groups act as virtual firewalls attached to EC2 instances to filter inbound and outbound traffic.

questions.question: Which AWS services can be used to improve the performance of a global application and reduce latency for its users? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront and AWS Global Accelerator improve performance and reduce latency globally.

questions.question: Using Amazon RDS falls under the shared responsibility model. Which of the following are customer responsibilities? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: With RDS, customers manage database schemas and settings, while AWS manages infrastructure and patching.

questions.question: A company has a large amount of structured data stored in their on-premises data center. They are planning to migrate all the data to AWS, what is the most appropriate AWS database option?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS is suitable for structured data migration from on-premises relational databases.

questions.question: A company has created a solution that helps AWS customers improve their architectures on AWS. Which AWS program may support this company?
questions.explanation: APN Consulting Partners help AWS customers improve architectures and solutions.

questions.question: What is the AWS serverless service that allows you to run your applications without any administrative burden?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda lets you run serverless applications without provisioning or managing servers.

questions.question: Jessica is managing an e-commerce web application in AWS. The application is hosted on six EC2 instances. One day, three of the instances crashed; but none of her customers were affected. What has Jessica done correctly in this scenario?

options.text: She has properly built an elastic system.
She has properly built a fault tolerant system.
She has properly built an encrypted system.
She has properly built a scalable system.

questions.explanation: Jessica built a fault-tolerant system, ensuring availability despite EC2 instance failures.
